page.title: 18Changes In The Village
page.content: There have been many changes in the village since the turn of the century. The work on building the council housing estate was started before 1916 and continued for several years. During the Second World War, a large site of temporary hostal accomadation was built on the outskirts of the village to house some of the workers from the arsenal at Bridgend. This site had disappeared by the mid 1950's. Perhaps the most important change to affect the village was the building of the M4 motorway link between Cardiff and Sarn Park. This has allowed people to travel further afield to work, and the population of the village has increased.
